Comment 3: 
Seems to me that it would be better to add a 'sanitizing' method for anybody using
URL.String() to use, if they want to (but if they want to keep the password in there,
for whatever reason, let them), and then add a special case in the error reporting code,
since a) we know the password shouldn't be seen there, and b) most people won't think to
call the sanitizing function there.

Just an idea.
